name: Azeban
skill: Deception +6, Perception +1, Sleight of hand +5, Stealth +5
resist: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Elusive
text: The azeban can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
text: The azeban has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
text: The azeban's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights, disguise self, faerie fire, minor illusion
3/day each: creation, major image, mislead, seeming

action.name: Multiattack
text: The azeban makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Ear-Splitting Yawp (Recharge 5-6)
text: The azeban emits a piercing yell in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 (6d6) thunder damage and is deafened for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage but isn't deafened. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.

spells: dancing lights, disguise self, faerie fire, minor illusion, creation, major image, mislead, seeming, mirage arcane, programmed illusion
